citation.article-title: Marinobacter lacisalsi sp. nov., a moderately halophilic bacterium isolated from the saline-wetland wildfowl reserve Fuente de Piedra in southern Spain
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Marinobacter lacisalsi sp. nov.
Marinobacter lacisalsi (la.ci.sal′si. L. n. lacus lake; L. adj. salsus salted, salt; N.L. gen. n. lacisalsi of a salt lake, the habitat from which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming rods that are 0.6–0.9×1.9–2.4 μm in size.
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Colonies on MH medium are yellowish, circular, smooth and convex.
Growth occurs in the presence of 3–15 % (w/v) NaCl; optimal growth occurs in the presence of 7.5 % NaCl.
No growth occurs in the absence of salt.
Growth occurs at 20–40 °C, with optimum growth at 30–35 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7.0; growth is observed at pH 5.0–9.0.
Catalase and oxidase are produced.
Strictly aerobic.

Acid is produced from d-glucose, maltose and trehalose, but not from adonitol, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-galactose, glycerol, myo-inositol, lactose, d-mannitol, mannose, melezitose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, d-salicin or xylose.
Tween 80 is hydrolysed, but DNA, casein, aesculin, gelatin, starch and tyrosine are not.
Alkaline phosphatase test is positive, but indole, methyl red, Voges–Proskauer, urease and phenylalanine deaminase tests are negative.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
H2S production from cysteine, haemolysis and growth on cetrimide agar are negative.
The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon and energy source: acetate, citrate, formate, gluconate, hydroxybutyrate, lactate, oxalate, propionate, pyruvate, succinate and tartrate.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole carbon and energy source, or as carbon, nitrogen and energy sources: l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, lactose, maltose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, sucrose, trehalose, xylose, fumarate, malonate, adonitol, dulcitol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-histidine, dl-isoleucine, l-lysine, l-ornithine, l-serine, l-tryptophan and l-valine.

Susceptible to amoxicillin (25 μg), ampicillin (10 μg), chloramphenicol (30 μg), nalidixic acid (30 μg), penicillin G (10 IU), polymyxin B (300 IU) and rifampicin (30 μg), but resistant to erythromycin (15 μg) and streptomycin (10 μg).
Major fatty acids are C12 : 0, C12 : 0 3-OH, C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω9c, C18 : 0 and C18 : 1ω9c when grown on MH medium containing 7.5 % (w/v) total salts.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 58.6 mol% (Tm).
The type strain, FP2.5T (=CECT 7297T=LMG 24237T), was isolated from a hypersaline water sample collected in the saline-wetland wildfowl reserve Fuente de Piedra (Málaga, southern Spain).
